notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

body.p: A concert was given last night at the Wicker Park Hall, the proceeds of which will be used to erect a monument over the grave of Professor John W. Colberg, the well-known Norwegian musician and director. When the committee asked the agent at Wicker Park Hall what the rental of the Hall would be, the answer was, "Not a cent!" All the printing and advertising were donated, and all the artists offered their services without charge.

Madame Ragna Linne is so well-known that she need not be discussed; Miss Adelheid Welterding, mezzo-soprano, is also very well known. The Swede, Gustav Holmquist, also offered his assistance. The Norwegian Singers' League and several individual choruses contributed their services.

row.cell: Haarklon Norsemen's Singing Society; Albert Ottesen, soloist Christian Nilsson, director
3. a) "Hear Me, Ye Wind and Waves"
Bartok Gustav Holmquist, basso; Billy Meyer, accompanist

Norwegian Singers' League of Chicago; Alfred Paulsen, director Tableau: Grieg, Bjornson, Ole Bull, and Ibsen
